==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|竹|alt1=⺮|t1=bamboo|寺|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p}}.

{{zh-l|*竹}} here refers to the bamboo strips used for writing (e.g. grading, classification) in ancient times. {{och-l|寺}} was originally used phonetically; the character was subsequently borrowed for another word with the same meaning, but with no phonetic resemblance to {{zh-l|*寺}}.

==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=3|rs=竹06}}

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[とう]] (tō)
|kanon=[[とう]] (tō)
|kun=[[ひとしい]] ([[等しい]], hitoshii), [[など]] (nado), [[なんど]] (nando) {{non-joyo-reading}}, [[ら]] (ra)
}}

====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|劣等|れっとう}}: inferior
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|とう|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=とう}} {{m|zh|等|tr=tong<sup>X</sup>||step, grade}}, extended to mean ''... kind of thing''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|とう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Adverb====
{{ja-pos|adverb|とう}}

# {{l|en|et cetera}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|とう}}

# rank, class, order
# {{l|en|et cetera}}, that {{l|en|kind}} of thing, and so on

=====Usage notes=====
For the ''et cetera'' sense, the ''tō'' reading is somewhat more formal than the ''nado'' reading.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|など}}
From earlier {{m|ja|なんど|tr=nando||etc., and so forth, and such like}}, from earlier {{m|ja|何と|tr=nani to|lit=and what||etc., and so forth, and such like}}, itself a compound of {{m|ja|何|tr=nani||what}} + {{m|ja|と|tr=to||and}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|など}}

====Adverb====
{{ja-pos|adverb|など}}

# {{l|en|et cetera}}, that {{l|en|kind}} of thing, and so on
#: {{ja-usex|魚や肉'''等'''|さかな や にく '''など'''|'''things like''' fish or meat, fish and meat '''et cetera / and other such things'''}}

=====Usage notes=====
For the ''et cetera'' sense, the ''tō'' reading is somewhat more formal than the ''nado'' reading.

Often spelled in hiragana, as {{m|ja|など}}.

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|なんど}}
From earlier {{m|ja|何と|tr=nani to|lit=and what||etc., and so forth, and such like}}, itself a compound of {{m|ja|何|tr=nani||what}} + {{m|ja|と|tr=to||and}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|なんど}}

====Adverb====
{{ja-pos|adverb|なんど}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=なんど|archaic|mostly|_|obsolete}} {{l|en|et cetera}}, that {{l|en|kind}} of thing, and so on

=====Usage notes=====
Largely {{l|en|supersede}}d by the ''nado'' reading above.

May be spelled in hiragana, as {{m|ja|なんど}}.

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ら}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ら}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ら}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|ら}}

# {{non-gloss definition|pluralizer}}
#: {{ja-usex|我、我'''等'''、これ、これ'''等'''|われ、われ'''ら'''、これ、これ'''ら'''|I, '''we''', this, '''these'''}}
# {{non-gloss definition|qualifier, softener}}: around abouts
#: {{ja-usex|今日'''等'''、そこ'''等'''辺|きょう'''ら'''、そこ'''ら''' へん|roughly today, that area '''around''' there}}

=====Usage notes=====
Often spelled in hiragana, as {{m|ja|ら}}.
